Definitions/Paraplegic.title: Paraplegic
Definitions/Paraplegic.content: Paraplegia is a type of Paralysis that affects the lower half of your body, including both legs. It is typically caused by an injury to the spinal cord.

Neural-Anatomy.title: Neural Anatomy
Neural-Anatomy.content:
Central Nervous System Disorder
Trauma (cause)
Stroke (cause)
Spinal Cord Injury (cause)
From my understanding, when brain cannot send signal or get sensory information from the body, then that condition is what paralysis is
upper motor neurons (what are their roles)

Spastic Paralysis (type) tight muscles


lower motor neurons (what are their roles)

Flasis Paralysis (type)


Acute Flasid Myolite (AFM) young people under 21 interior of spinal chord but can feel touch and pain
Kimbery Syndrome (CIDP) (GBS)
Blood Cloth or Deep Vain Thrombosis (DVT) rises from immobility
ALS (risky is respiratory failure) SEI patient
UTI, Constipation
Neurosurgery, Glutomate Signaling
BCI - Neurolink, Blackrock, Mindmaze
